issue.title: Spawning multiple gpu_ray sensors with same name causes OGRE exception

content.raw:
`rendering::Camera` doesn't have this issue because in [Camera::CreateCamera](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c76e90858d58b0e35c8f2ea776159dc16cb146bb/gazebo/rendering/Camera.cc?at=default#cl-1258), it uses `this->scopedUniqueName`, which is [created in the constructor](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c76e90858d58b0e35c8f2ea776159dc16cb146bb/gazebo/rendering/Camera.cc?at=default#cl-73) using a static `cameraCounter` variable.

`rendering::GpuLaser` doesn't have a static counter or a unique name, it just uses the desired name in [GpuLaser::CreateOrthoCam](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c76e90858d58b0e35c8f2ea776159dc16cb146bb/gazebo/rendering/GpuLaser.cc?at=default#cl-463).
content.html:
rendering::Camera doesn't have this issue because in Camera::CreateCamera, it uses this->scopedUniqueName, which is created in the constructor using a static cameraCounter variable.

rendering::GpuLaser doesn't have a static counter or a unique name, it just uses the desired name in GpuLaser::CreateOrthoCam.
